alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 4:11AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Miami-Dade County through 445 AM EDT... At 411 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Princeton, or near Black Point, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Homestead, Coral Gables, Black Point, Kendall, The Redland, Pinecrest, Homestead Base, Naranja, Richmond West, Richmond Heights, Leisure City, Palmetto Bay, Cutler Bay, Zoo Miami, Goulds, West Perrine, Princeton, Homestead Bayfront Park, The Crossings and Country Walk. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
